user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_softirq_dispatch:
```c
void metal_softirq_dispatch(void)
{
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < metal_softirq_num; i++) {
		struct metal_irq *irq;
		char is_pending = 1;

		if (atomic_load(&metal_softirq_enabled[i]) != 0 &&
		    atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&metal_softirq_pending[i],
						   &is_pending, 0)) {
			irq = &metal_softirqs[i];
			(void)metal_irq_handle(irq,
					       i + metal_softirq_cntr.irq_base);
		}
	}
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_softirq_dispatch:

...

...

...

...
static METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE(metal_softirq_cntr,
				    METAL_IRQ_ANY, METAL_SOFTIRQ_NUM,
				    NULL,
				    metal_softirq_set_enable, NULL,
				    metal_softirqs)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No unreachable code was identified in the provided function. The control flow is straightforward: a for loop iterates from i = 0 to i < metal_softirq_num; the body contains local declarations and a conditional that may or may not be entered at run time. There are no early returns, break/continue statements that skip later code unconditionally, no goto targets that are never reached, no constant false conditions, and no code following an unconditional infinite loop or after a return/goto that would make it unreachable. The conditional uses atomic operations whose outcomes depend on runtime state; therefore the call to metal_irq_handle is reachable when those conditions are met. The local variable declarations (irq, is_pending) are in-scope and used, and do not constitute unreachable code. Given only the shown code and the related controller declaration, there is no evidence of any fragment that can never be executed, so nothing needs investigation under MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.1.
